intro: [WRONG START] Origanum vulgage var. creticum, commonly known as Cretan oregano, is a perennial herb native to the Mediterranean region, particularly Greece. It is characterized by its aromatic, small, tubular flowers that range in color from white to pale pink. The plant produces small, oval-shaped leaves that are typically gray-green in color, covered in fine hairs. It thrives in well-drained soil and full sun, making it a popular choice for Mediterranean gardens. Its essential oils, rich in compounds like carvacrol and thymol, contribute to its strong, spicy aroma and medicinal properties.
